title: Adding account fails with code 0x80004005
content:
I have two email accounts on my website that is hosted by Hostpapa. Years ago I successfully set up email for both accounts in Thunderbird. Recently (probably after an upgrade) one of the accounts stopped working and I get a timed out message when fetching email messages. After checking the server settings and password were correct the problem was not fixed, so I deleted the account and tried to re-add it in Thunderbird. The incoming and outgoing server settings are correct as is the password. I know the password is correct because I can successfully login to the account using webmail. I received the following error message on the "Setup your Existing Email Address" page. The message appears above the "Checking Password" button.

"Component returned failure code: 0x80004005 (NS_ERROR_FAILURE) [nsiMsgAccountManager.createIncomingServer]

The password on the account is 16 characters long and contains the following special characters: "!#"

I am using Thunderbird version 115.11.1 (64-bit) - on the esr channel

Can anyone help?
creator: kkaffy

title: Thunderbird - conversazioni da leggere
content:
Buongiorno a tutti, avrei bisogno di modificare la visualizzazione delle mail da leggere con la visualizzazione a conversazioni. In caso all'interno di una conversazione ci sia una mail da leggere, e la conversazione sia ridotta facendo vedere solo la prima mail, la mail principale viene visualizzata sottolineata. In caso di mail singola, invece, viene visualizzata in grassetto, ed è molto più visibile. Sarebbe possibile modificare la visualizzazione della conversazione con all'interno mail da leggere, magari evidenziando la conversazione ridotta in maniera diversa? (esempio: mettendo in grassetto e/o di un altro colore la conversazione ridotta?)

resto in attesa grazie mille
creator: andreagiorgi11

title: Ziggo certificaat niet vertrouwd
content:
Hallo! Ik probeer een account te maken voor een ziggo-mailadres, maar ik krijg te horen dat het certificaat niet wordt vertrouwd.

Met een medewerker van ziggo heb ik alle instellingen langsgelopen, die zouden moeten kloppen.

Emailadres eindigt op @home.nl


Gebruikersnaam is het hele emailadres Inkomend: imap.ziggo.nl SSL/TLS, poort 993 Uitgaand smtp.ziggo.nl STARTTLS, poort 587

Via ziggo's webmail kan ik inloggen met gebruikersnaam en wachtwoord

Als ik aangeef een beveiligingsuitzondering te willen maken (en evt deze permanent op wil slaan), blijft de popup terugkomen.

Ik kan het certificaat weergeven, maar als ik voor opvragen kies blijft het hangen.

title: Paid app
content: Why don’t you guys grow up and just charge money for the application like every other successful app? Stop begging for contributions and just charge a fee for the app. I think you’ll find you’ll do quite well and you’ll stop nagging the rest of us who are paying. You all are stuck in this FOSS ideology. It doesn’t exist, Yes, there have been quite a few “Free“ applications developed, but they were funded by someone donating. Usually some liberal cause. Just charge for the app and move on. You will find that you will have a steady stream of income and you’ll be able to develop it more consistently. You might be able to innovate. Who knows, you might even be able to develop a UI that doesn’t look like it was designed in 1995

title: O365 Folder Sync: TBSync
content:
I've installed TBSync with Thunderbird and my O365 calendar is now syncing.

However, my email subfolders are not fully updating.

I have a # of subfolders I've created in O365 but they aren't appearing in TBSync in order to choose them to sync in Thunderbird. I am getting some (what I would call 'standard') subfolders in TBSync to choose such as Contact, Calendar, Tasks, and some other email accounts I have 'sync'd' into O365, but none of the actual email subfolders for the O365 account itself (i.e. 2024 Financials).

In Thunderbird, the only folders I see to sync (Synchronization & Storage > Advanced)are: Inbox, Draft, Sent, and Trash

What am I doing wrong or missing?
creator: eric.gombrich

title: Thunderbird Not Responding
content:
For the past several years I have been dealing with Thunderbird occasionally freezing on me, with the window losing focus and the titlebar saying (Not Responding).

It appears to happen when TB is downloading email. If the emails are large (as some are) TB stops everything to deal with it. I have looked for where to change any settings to allow for process threading, since that was the promise of Windows waaaaay back in 1990. Not so, apparently with TB. Even if I'm in a separate window composing an email, it freezes. I wrote about this back in 2018...

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1233121

I noticed that this only happens when downloading emails from one particular account, which I use for receiving project code error debug reports. The emails are typically around 150k or slightly less. Not so huge that it should take so long to pull down, but the debug info is in many, many nested tables and divs. Is it trying to render them, even though I don't have them open?

In any case, I set that account to no longer collect. Yet, every once in a while, it still collects. Do I need to remove the account from TB altogether? I would like to be able to have this account checked every 15 minutes like my other five email accounts, which don't cause me any heartache, but it's driving me mad, especially when a throng of those emails come in, like 50 at a time, and I am effectively prevented from doing anything in TB for up to five minutes. I suppose I could craft the emails to be smaller (it's my own code that is sending the debug reports) but the info in there is there on purpose.

Is there a setting I can change somewhere to break off the processing for the main window and the compose windows?
creator: michaelmuller

title: This week my thunderbird stopped reading icloud emails
content:
I have been successfully accessing my icloud account with thunderbird on Windows 10 for years and then on Tuesday (June 4th) it went weird. All I am left with is thunderbird's cached inbox e-mails. If I try to update the list of new e-mails, it just sits there with no errors reported. If I try to read some cached e-mails I can see the full text. (I am setup to always read plain text), but for some, I just get whitespace. I see "myname@icloud.com connected to imap.mail.me.com..." on the status line for most folders, but some just clear that status message.

Roy
creator: robroy019

title: Schedule time when Thunderbird doesn't check for new mail, for each account
content:
Is there a way to schedule a time (daily or weekly) during which Thunderbird doesn't check for new mail?

I have several mail accounts, some for work, some private. I want Thunderbird checking for new mail on my work accounts during my work hours, and pause checking when I get off work. I don't want Thunderbird to check my private mail while I'm at work (or specifically, up until an hour before the end of my workday).

Eg. I'd like to "tell" Thunderbird to check my work account monday to friday from 8am to 5pm, and my private account every workday from 4pm to 8am and every weekend all day. Ideally, clicking on "get new mail" would only fetch mail for the currently unpaused accounts.

I don't want to have to manually pause checking for messages for each account several times a day.

The "check for new messages every ___ minutes" doesn't help.

Disabling notifications isn't a solution - I need the messages (especially work messages) not to be downloaded from the server (or receive notification that there's mail waiting). I'm looking to "disconnect" from work while keeping up to speed with my private communications.
creator: perunskaya
